intro: Klasea centauroides subsp. centauroides, commonly known as the Cape rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a trailing growth habit and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
